job_details.Vacaturetitel: Senior Backend Engineer C# | Abuse Protection
job_details.Functieomschrijving:
The Abuse Protection team's mission is to identify, monitor and block traffic that harms DeepL's users, systems, or business. The team ensure that both free users and paying customers do not abuse DeepL's services through excessive or malicious requests, by monitoring and managing usage data, as well as building the necessary interventions when something seems amiss. The team is responsible for DeepL's shared services for bot protection, rate limiting and usage limitation.
   The teams' tech stack includes
     * C# and ASP.NET Core on Linux in Kubernetes for backend services,
     * Typescript for web clients and Cloudflare workers,
     * Python for scripting and tooling,
     * Kafka,
     * PostgreSQL, Clickhouse,
     * Grafana, Prometheus, Loki, Tempo,
     * GitLab, ArgoCD.

   Your responsibilities
     * Design, implement, and maintain a scalable, high-throughput back-end traffic and usage monitoring and analysis system
     * Contribute to ensuring the high availability and reliability of DeepL's service even in the event of attacks
     * Integrate automatic blocking of malicious clients into all backend services
     * Incorporate advanced bot detection and fraud prevention technologies

   What we offer
     * Diverse and internationally distributed team: joining our team means becoming part of a large, global community with people of more than 90 nationalities. We're more than just colleagues; we're a group of professionals with a shared mission to connect diverse cultures. Our global presence is growing-we've doubled in size nearly every year, with our employees based in the UK, Germany, the Netherlands, Poland, the US, and Japan, and we continue to expand our network.

     * Open communication, regular feedback: as a language-focused company, we value the importance of clear, honest communication. We value smooth collaboration, direct and actionable feedback, and believe that leading with empathy makes us better together.

     * Remote work, flexible hours: whether you're near or in our hubs in cities like Cologne, Berlin, Amsterdam, London, or prefer the comfort of your own home, you decide where your office is. We offer remote opportunities, flexible working hours and trust in your productivity, all in sync with your team's general locations and time zones to foster effective and seamless collaboration. Our aim is to integrate your work with your lifestyle, ensuring a balance that respects both your needs and our operational requirements.

     *
       Regular in-person team events: we bond over vibrant events that are as unique as our team, from local team and business unit gatherings, to new-joiner onboardings, to company-wide events that bring us all together-literally.

     * Monthly full-day hacking sessions: every month, we have Hack Fridays, where you can spend your time diving into a project you're passionate about and get the opportunity to work with other teams-we value your initiatives, impact, and creativity.

     * Comprehensive health insurance: your health comes first. With our comprehensive insurance, we'll make sure you're covered from head to toe.

     * 30 days of annual leave: we value your peace of mind. With 30 days off (excluding public holidays) and access to mental health resources, we make sure you're as strong mentally as you are professionally.

     * Annual learning budget: because we never stop learning, we've set up an annual budget for your professional development-pick a learning path which contributes to your career development and we'll back you up.
job_details.full_text:
Senior Backend Engineer C# | Abuse Protection

The Abuse Protection team's mission is to identify, monitor and block traffic that harms DeepL's users, systems, or business. The team ensure that both free users and paying customers do not abuse DeepL's services through excessive or malicious requests, by monitoring and managing usage data, as well as building the necessary interventions when something seems amiss. The team is responsible for DeepL's shared services for bot protection, rate limiting and usage limitation.
   The teams' tech stack includes
     * C# and ASP.NET Core on Linux in Kubernetes for backend services,
     * Typescript for web clients and Cloudflare workers,
     * Python for scripting and tooling,
     * Kafka,
     * PostgreSQL, Clickhouse,
     * Grafana, Prometheus, Loki, Tempo,
     * GitLab, ArgoCD.

   Your responsibilities
     * Design, implement, and maintain a scalable, high-throughput back-end traffic and usage monitoring and analysis system
     * Contribute to ensuring the high availability and reliability of DeepL's service even in the event of attacks
     * Integrate automatic blocking of malicious clients into all backend services
     * Incorporate advanced bot detection and fraud prevention technologies

   What we offer
     * Diverse and internationally distributed team: joining our team means becoming part of a large, global community with people of more than 90 nationalities. We're more than just colleagues; we're a group of professionals with a shared mission to connect diverse cultures. Our global presence is growing-we've doubled in size nearly every year, with our employees based in the UK, Germany, the Netherlands, Poland, the US, and Japan, and we continue to expand our network.

     * Open communication, regular feedback: as a language-focused company, we value the importance of clear, honest communication. We value smooth collaboration, direct and actionable feedback, and believe that leading with empathy makes us better together.

     * Remote work, flexible hours: whether you're near or in our hubs in cities like Cologne, Berlin, Amsterdam, London, or prefer the comfort of your own home, you decide where your office is. We offer remote opportunities, flexible working hours and trust in your productivity, all in sync with your team's general locations and time zones to foster effective and seamless collaboration. Our aim is to integrate your work with your lifestyle, ensuring a balance that respects both your needs and our operational requirements.

     *
       Regular in-person team events: we bond over vibrant events that are as unique as our team, from local team and business unit gatherings, to new-joiner onboardings, to company-wide events that bring us all together-literally.

     * Monthly full-day hacking sessions: every month, we have Hack Fridays, where you can spend your time diving into a project you're passionate about and get the opportunity to work with other teams-we value your initiatives, impact, and creativity.

     * Comprehensive health insurance: your health comes first. With our comprehensive insurance, we'll make sure you're covered from head to toe.

     * 30 days of annual leave: we value your peace of mind. With 30 days off (excluding public holidays) and access to mental health resources, we make sure you're as strong mentally as you are professionally.

     * Annual learning budget: because we never stop learning, we've set up an annual budget for your professional development-pick a learning path which contributes to your career development and we'll back you up.

profile_classification.rationale: The job description focuses on backend engineering for abuse protection, involving C#, ASP.NET Core, and system monitoring. While it touches upon data monitoring and analysis, it does not involve the core responsibilities or technologies associated with ML Engineering or GenAI Engineering, such as algorithm development, predictive modeling, LLMs, or generative techniques. The role is primarily traditional software engineering with a focus on security and system reliability, making it fall under the 'Ambiguous' category as it's not a technical AI role as defined in the coding book.

job_tasks.justification: The responsibilities include 'Design, implement, and maintain a scalable, high-throughput back-end traffic and usage monitoring and analysis system', 'Integrate automatic blocking of malicious clients into all backend services', and 'Incorporate advanced bot detection and fraud prevention technologies'. These are core software development activities focused on building and maintaining backend services.
job_tasks.phrase: Design, implement, and maintain a scalable, high-throughput back-end traffic and usage monitoring and analysis system

job_tasks.justification: Ensuring high availability and reliability, especially during attacks, is a critical aspect of robust backend service development.
job_tasks.phrase: Contribute to ensuring the high availability and reliability of DeepL's service even in the event of attacks

job_tasks.justification: Integrating blocking mechanisms into backend services is a direct software development task.
job_tasks.phrase: Integrate automatic blocking of malicious clients into all backend services

job_tasks.justification: Incorporating bot detection and fraud prevention technologies into the system is a software development responsibility.
job_tasks.phrase: Incorporate advanced bot detection and fraud prevention technologies

job_tasks.justification: The mission 'to identify, monitor and block traffic that harms DeepL's users, systems, or business' and ensuring users 'do not abuse DeepL's services through excessive or malicious requests' demonstrates an understanding of business goals and user impact.
job_tasks.phrase: identify, monitor and block traffic that harms DeepL's users, systems, or business

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'monitoring and managing usage data' implies tasks related to data collection and processing for the purpose of abuse protection.

soft_skills.phrase: building the necessary interventions when something seems amiss
we value your initiatives, impact, and creativity
